alert.note: Alert for Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 1:01PM EDT until July 11 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont...New Hampshire... Connecticut River At West Lebanon affecting Windsor, Grafton, Orange and Sullivan Counties. Connecticut River AT North Walpole affecting Windsor, Sullivan, Windham and Cheshire Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Grafton and Belknap Counties. Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. .Repeated rounds of heavy rain and overly saturated soils in western New Hampshire and eastern Vermont will rapidly increase river stages along the Connecticut, Sugar and Pemigewasset River basins. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at West Lebanon. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Water starts entering the parking lot of the shopping plaza in West Lebanon just north of Interstate 89 along Main Street in Lebanon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 23.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
